channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: Understanding China’s Quest for Quantum Advancement
item.description: China's investments in quantum technology began with foundational research in 2001. This article examines where China stands today in its efforts to build capabilities across five quantum technology areas and how it is pursuing quantum innovation leadership.

item.title: Unwinding Venezuela’s CRINK Ties in the Western Hemisphere
item.description: CSIS Americas Director Ryan C. Berg outlines options for the United States to effectively reduce the influence of China, Russia, Iran, and North Korea in Venezuela.

item.title: Why the Army Needs Deception Groups
item.description: To outsmart modern threats, the U.S. Army must bring back “ghost armies”—dedicated deception units that manipulate what the enemy sees and believes, creating the space and confusion needed to maneuver and win on today’s transparent battlefield.

item.title: Eyes on the Prize: CCG Patrols Prioritize Scarborough in 2025
item.description: China Coast Guard patrols are evolving.
